name: paloalto-cortex-xdr
label: Palo Alto Cortex XDR
description: Cortex XDR applies machine learning at cloud scale to rich network, endpoint, and cloud data, so you can quickly find and stop targeted attacks, insider abuse, and compromised endpoints.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: Specify the URL of the Palo Alto Cortex XDR server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.name: authentication_type
fields.title: Authentication Type
fields.description: Select this authentication type as Standard Key or Advanced Key.
fields.tooltip: Select this authentication type as Standard Key or Advanced Key.

fields.title: API Key ID
fields.name: api_key_id
fields.description: Specify the ID of the API key configured for your account to access the Palo Alto Cortex XDR server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.tooltip: Specify the ID of the API key configured for your account to access the Palo Alto Cortex XDR server.

fields.title: API Key
fields.name: api_key
fields.description: Specify the API key configured for your account to access the Palo Alto Cortex XDR server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations. Note: You require a "Standard" security level API key.
fields.tooltip: Specify the API key configured for your account to access the Palo Alto Cortex XDR server.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Fetch Incidents
operations.description: Retrieves all incidents or specific incidents from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID List
parameters.name: filter.in.incident_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of incident IDs. Each item in the list must be an incident ID.
parameters.description: Specify the list of incident IDs that you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Each item in the list must be an incident ID. For example, ["1234","1235"]

parameters.title: Created After
parameters.name: filter.gte.creation_time
parameters.tooltip: Incidents created after this time
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the incidents retrieved by this operation to include only those incidents that were created at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: Created Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.creation_time
parameters.tooltip: Incidents created before this time
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the incidents retrieved by this operation to include only those incidents that were created at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Modified After
parameters.name: filter.gte.modification_time
parameters.tooltip: Incidents modified after this time
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the incidents retrieved by this operation to include only those incidents that were modified at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: Modified Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.modification_time
parameters.tooltip: Incidents modified before this time
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the incidents retrieved by this operation to include only those incidents that were modified at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Alert Sources
parameters.name: filter.in.alert_sources
parameters.tooltip: List of sources which detected the alert. Even if you have one source it has to be a list of one element
parameters.description: Specify the sources which detected the alert and whose associated incidents you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, ["XDR Agent"].

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: filter.eq.status
parameters.tooltip: List of sources which detected the alert. Even if you have one source it has to be a list of one element
parameters.description: Select the status using which you want to filter the incidents retrieved by this operation. You can choose from options such as New, Resolved Known Issue, Resolved Auto, etc.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: filter.contains.description
parameters.tooltip: Search by keyword in the description of the incident
parameters.description: Specify the description of the incident you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Search From
parameters.name: cursor.search_from
parameters.tooltip: Integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want incidents returned.
parameters.description: Specify the integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want this operation to return incidents from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Search To
parameters.name: cursor.search_to
parameters.tooltip: Integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want incidents returned.
parameters.description: Specify the integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want this operation to return incidents from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Sort by Field
parameters.name: sort.field
parameters.tooltip: The field by which you want to sort the incidents.
parameters.description: Select the field by which you want to sort the incidents retrieved by this operation. You can choose between creation_time or modification_time.

parameters.title: Sort by Order
parameters.name: sort.keyword
parameters.tooltip: The order by which you want to sort the incidents.
parameters.description: Select this option to order the incidents retrieved by this operation. You can choose between asc (ascending) or desc (Descending).

operations.title: Get Incident Details
operations.description: Retrieves details, including alerts and key artifacts, for a specific incident from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the incident ID and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the incident for which you want to retrieve extra data.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose details (including related alerts and key artifacts) you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Alerts Limit
parameters.name: alerts_limit
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of related alerts in the incident that you want to retrieve. Default: 1000
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of alerts related to the specified incident you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. By default, this is set to '1000'.

operations.title: Update Incident
operations.description: Updates incident fields like severity, status, etc. of a specific incident in Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the incident ID and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the incident.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident whose details you want to update in Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Assigned User Mail
parameters.name: assigned_user_mail
parameters.tooltip: Updated email address of the incident assignee.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the email address of the assignee to whom you want to assign the specified incident in Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Assigned User Pretty Name
parameters.name: assigned_user_pretty_name
parameters.tooltip: Updated full name of the incident assignee.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the full name of the assignee to whom you want to assign the specified incident in Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Manual Severity
parameters.name: manual_severity
parameters.tooltip: The severity of the incident.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the severity level that you want to assign to the specified incident in Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose from the following options: High, Medium, Low, Critical, or Informational.

parameters.title: Status
parameters.name: status
parameters.tooltip: The status of the incident.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the status level that you want to assign to the specified incident in Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose from the following options: New, Under Investigation, Resolved Threat Handled, Resolved Know Issue, Resolved Duplicate, Resolved False Positive, or Resolved Other.

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.name: comment

true.title: Comment Action
true.name: comment_action
true.description: Specify the action that should be performed for the comments, i.e., enter 'add' to add the comment to the specified incident.

true.title: Value
true.name: value
true.tooltip: Value for comment explaining the incident change.
true.description: Add the comment that explains the updates made to the specified incident.

parameters.tooltip: Comment explaining the incident change.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option if you want to include a comment that explains the updates made to the specified incident. If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters: Comment Action: Specify the action that should be performed for the comments, i.e., enter 'add' to add the comment to the specified incident. Value: Add the comment that explains the updates made to the specified incident.

parameters.title: Resolve Comment
parameters.name: resolve_comment
parameters.tooltip: Descriptive comment explaining the incident change.
parameters.description: (Optional) Add a descriptive comment that explains the updates made to the specified incident.

operations.title: Insert CEF Alerts
operations.description: Uploads alerts in the CEF format from external alert sources to Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the list of alerts specified. Note: After you have mapped the CEF alert fields to Cortex XDR fields, Cortex XDR displays the alerts in related incidents and views.

parameters.title: Alerts
parameters.name: alerts
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of alerts in CEF format.
parameters.description: Specify a comma-separated list of alerts in the CEF format that you want to add (upload) to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

operations.title: Insert Parsed Alerts
operations.description: Uploads alerts in the Cortex XDR format from external alert sources to Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the product, vendor, and other input parameters specified. Cortex XDR displays alerts that are parsed successfully in related incidents and views.

parameters.title: Alert Name
parameters.name: alert_name
parameters.tooltip: String defining the alert name.
parameters.description: Specify the string defining the name of the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Product
parameters.name: product
parameters.tooltip: String value that defines the product. For example, VPN & Firewall-1.
parameters.description: Specify the string value that defines the product related to the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, VPN & Firewall-1

parameters.title: Vendor
parameters.name: vendor
parameters.tooltip: String value that defines the vendor. For example, Check Point.
parameters.description: Specify the string value that defines the vendor related to the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, Check Point

parameters.title: Local Port
parameters.name: local_port
parameters.tooltip: Integer value for the source port.
parameters.description: Specify the integer value for the source port related to the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Remote IP
parameters.name: remote_ip
parameters.tooltip: String value of the destination IP address.
parameters.description: Specify the string value of the destination IP address related to the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Remote Port
parameters.name: remote_port
parameters.tooltip: Integer value for the destination port.
parameters.description: Specify the integer value for the destination port related to the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Local IP
parameters.name: local_ip
parameters.tooltip: String value for the source IP address.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the string value for the source IP address related to the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Event Timestamp
parameters.name: event_timestamp
parameters.tooltip: Time the alert occurred.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the occurrence DateTime of the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Severity
parameters.name: severity
parameters.tooltip: The severity of the alert.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the severity of the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose from the following options: Informational, High, Medium, Low, or Unknown.

parameters.title: Alert Description
parameters.name: alert_description
parameters.tooltip: String defining the alert description.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the string value that contains the description of the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Action Status
parameters.name: action_status
parameters.tooltip: String defining the alert action status. e.g. Reported
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the string value that defines the action status of the alert that you want to upload to Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

operations.title: Isolate Endpoints
operations.description: Isolates one or more endpoints in a single request on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the endpoint ID and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Isolate Endpoint

Isolate One Endpoint.title: Endpoint ID
Isolate One Endpoint.name: endpoint_id
Isolate One Endpoint.tooltip: String that identifies the endpoint to isolate.
Isolate One Endpoint.description: If you select Isolate One Endpoint, then in the Endpoint ID field specify the ID of the endpoint you want to isolate on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

Isolate More Than One Endpoint.title: Endpoint ID List
Isolate More Than One Endpoint.name: endpoint_id_list
Isolate More Than One Endpoint.description: If you select Isolate More Than One Endpoint, then in the Endpoint ID List field specify a list of endpoint IDs you want to isolate on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.name: isolate_endpoint
parameters.tooltip: Isolate one endpoint or more than one endpoint.
parameters.description: Select whether you want to isolate one endpoint or multiple endpoints. If you select Isolate One Endpoint, then in the Endpoint ID field specify the ID of the endpoint you want to isolate on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. If you select Isolate More Than One Endpoint, then in the Endpoint ID List field specify a list of endpoint IDs you want to isolate on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: Incident ID.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ID of the incident to include the Isolate Endpoints action in the Cortex XDR Incident ViewTimeline tab.

operations.title: Unisolate Endpoints
operations.description: Unisolates one or more endpoints in a single request on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the endpoint ID and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Unisolate Endpoint

Unisolate One Endpoint.title: Endpoint ID
Unisolate One Endpoint.name: endpoint_id
Unisolate One Endpoint.tooltip: String that identifies the endpoint to unisolate.
Unisolate One Endpoint.description: If you select Unisolate One Endpoint, then in the Endpoint ID field specify the ID of the endpoint you want to unisolate on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

Unisolate More Than One Endpoint.title: Endpoint ID List
Unisolate More Than One Endpoint.name: endpoint_id_list
Unisolate More Than One Endpoint.description: If you select Unisolate More Than One Endpoint, then in the Endpoint ID List field specify a list of endpoint IDs you want to unisolate on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.name: unisolate_endpoint
parameters.tooltip: Unisolate one endpoint or more than one endpoint.
parameters.description: Select whether you want to unisolate one endpoint or multiple endpoints. If you select Unisolate One Endpoint, then in the Endpoint ID field specify the ID of the endpoint you want to unisolate on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. If you select Unisolate More Than One Endpoint, then in the Endpoint ID List field specify a list of endpoint IDs you want to unisolate on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: Incident ID.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ID of the incident to include the Unisolate Endpoints action in the Cortex XDR Incident ViewTimeline tab.

operations.title: Get All Endpoints
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all your endpoints from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

operations.title: Get Endpoints
operations.description: Retrieves a list of filtered endpoints from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID List
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of endpoint IDs.
parameters.description: Specify the list of endpoint IDs that you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Distribution Name
parameters.name: filter.in.dist_name
parameters.tooltip: Distribution / Installation Package name.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the distribution list or installation package name containing the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Group Name
parameters.name: filter.in.group_name
parameters.tooltip: Group name the agent belongs to.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the group containing the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Alias
parameters.name: filter.in.alias
parameters.tooltip: Endpoint alias name.
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Hostname
parameters.name: filter.in.hostname
parameters.tooltip: Name of host.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the host of the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.name: filter.in.username
parameters.tooltip: Name of the user.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the user associated with the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Endpoint Status
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_status
parameters.tooltip: Type of operating system. e.g. Connected, Disconnected, Lost, or Uninstalled.
parameters.description: Select the status of the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between Connected, Disconnected, Lost, or Uninstalled.

parameters.title: IP List
parameters.name: filter.in.ip_list
parameters.tooltip: List of ip addresses.
parameters.description: Specify the list of IP addresses containing the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Platform
parameters.name: filter.in.platform
parameters.tooltip: Type of operating system. e.g. windows, linux, macos, android
parameters.description: Select the type of operating system that contains the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between Windows, Linux, Macos, or Android.

parameters.title: Isolate
parameters.name: filter.in.isolate
parameters.tooltip: If an endpoint has been isolated.
parameters.description: Select the isolation status of the endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Select Isolated to retrieve endpoints that are isolated and Unisolated to retrieve endpoints that are unisolated.

parameters.title: Scan Status
parameters.name: filter.in.scan_status
parameters.tooltip: If an endpoint has been isolated.
parameters.description: Select the scan status of endpoints to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between None, Pending, In Progress, Cancelled, Aborted, Pending Cancellation, Sucess, or Error.

parameters.title: First Seen After
parameters.name: filter.gte.first_seen
parameters.tooltip: When the agent was first seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were first seen at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: First Seen Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.first_seen
parameters.tooltip: When the agent was first seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were first seen at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Last Seen After
parameters.name: filter.gte.last_seen
parameters.tooltip: When the agent was last seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were last seen at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: Last Seen Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.last_seen
parameters.tooltip: When the agent was last seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were last seen at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Search From
parameters.name: cursor.search_from
parameters.tooltip: Integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want endpoints returned.
parameters.description: Specify the integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want this operation to return endpoints from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Search To
parameters.name: cursor.search_to
parameters.tooltip: Integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want endpoints returned.
parameters.description: Specify the integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want this operation to return endpoints from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Sort by Field
parameters.name: sort.field
parameters.tooltip: The field by which you want to sort the endpoints.
parameters.description: Select the field by which you want to sort the endpoints retrieved by this operation. You can choose between first_seen or last_seen.

parameters.title: Sort by Order
parameters.name: sort.keyword
parameters.tooltip: The order by which you want to sort the endpoints.
parameters.description: Select this option to order the endpoints retrieved by this operation. You can choose between asc (ascending) or desc (Descending).

operations.title: Scan Endpoints
operations.description: Runs a scan on all endpoints or specified endpoints on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the list of endpoint IDs and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID List
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of endpoint IDs.
parameters.description: Specify the list of endpoint IDs that you want to scan on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Distribution Name
parameters.name: filter.in.dist_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the distribution list.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the distribution list containing the endpoints that you want to scan on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Group Name
parameters.name: filter.in.group_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of endpoint group.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the group containing the endpoints that you want to scan on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Alias
parameters.name: filter.in.alias
parameters.tooltip: Endpoint alias name.
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the endpoints to be scanned on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Hostname
parameters.name: filter.in.hostname
parameters.tooltip: Name of host.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the host of the endpoints to be scanned on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.name: filter.in.username
parameters.tooltip: Name of the user.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the user associated with the endpoints to be scanned on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: IP List
parameters.name: filter.in.ip_list
parameters.tooltip: List of ip addresses.
parameters.description: Specify the list of IP addresses containing the endpoints to be scanned on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Platform
parameters.name: filter.in.platform
parameters.tooltip: Type of operating system. e.g. windows, linux, macos, android
parameters.description: Select the type of operating system that contains the endpoints to be scanned on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between Windows, Linux, Macos, or Android.

parameters.title: Isolate
parameters.name: filter.in.isolate
parameters.tooltip: If an endpoint has been isolated.
parameters.description: Select the isolation status of the endpoints to be scanned on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Select Isolated to retrieve endpoints that are isolated and Unisolated to retrieve endpoints that are unisolated.

parameters.title: Scan Status
parameters.name: filter.in.scan_status
parameters.tooltip: If an endpoint has been isolated.
parameters.description: Select the scan status of endpoints to be scanned on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between None, Pending, In Progress, Cancelled, Aborted, Pending Cancellation, Sucess, or Error.

parameters.title: First Seen After
parameters.name: filter.gte.first_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was first seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were first seen at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: First Seen Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.first_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was first seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were first seen at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Last Seen After
parameters.name: filter.gte.last_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was last seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were last seen at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: Last Seen Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.last_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was last seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were last seen at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: Incident ID.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident to include the Scan Endpoints action in the Cortex XDR Incident ViewTimeline tab.

operations.title: Cancel Scan Endpoints
operations.description: Cancels a scan on all endpoints or specified endpoints on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the list of endpoint IDs and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID List
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of endpoint IDs.
parameters.description: Specify the list of endpoint IDs whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Distribution Name
parameters.name: filter.in.dist_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the distribution list.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the distribution list containing the endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Group Name
parameters.name: filter.in.group_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of endpoint group.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the group containing the endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Alias
parameters.name: filter.in.alias
parameters.tooltip: Endpoint alias name.
parameters.description: Specify the alias of the endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Hostname
parameters.name: filter.in.hostname
parameters.tooltip: Name of host.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the host of the endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.name: filter.in.username
parameters.tooltip: Name of the user.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the user associated with the endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: IP List
parameters.name: filter.in.ip_list
parameters.tooltip: List of ip addresses.
parameters.description: Specify the list of IP addresses containing the endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Platform
parameters.name: filter.in.platform
parameters.tooltip: Type of operating system. e.g. windows, linux, macos, android
parameters.description: Select the type of operating system that contains the endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between Windows, Linux, Macos, or Android.

parameters.title: Isolate
parameters.name: filter.in.isolate
parameters.tooltip: If an endpoint has been isolated.
parameters.description: Select the isolation status of the endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Select Isolated to retrieve endpoints that are isolated and Unisolated to retrieve endpoints that are unisolated.

parameters.title: Scan Status
parameters.name: filter.in.scan_status
parameters.tooltip: If an endpoint has been isolated.
parameters.description: Select the scan status of endpoints whose scan you want to cancel on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between None, Pending, In Progress, Cancelled, Aborted, Pending Cancellation, Sucess, or Error.

parameters.title: First Seen After
parameters.name: filter.gte.first_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was first seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were first seen at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: First Seen Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.first_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was first seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were first seen at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Last Seen After
parameters.name: filter.gte.last_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was last seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were last seen at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: Last Seen Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.last_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was last seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were last seen at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: Incident ID.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the incident to include the Cancel Scan Endpoints action in the Cortex XDR Incident ViewTimeline tab.

operations.title: Delete Endpoints
operations.description: Deletes the specified endpoints from the Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the list of endpoint IDs specified. Note: You can delete up to 100 endpoints.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID List
parameters.name: endpoint_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of endpoint IDs.
parameters.description: Specify a list of endpoint IDs that you want to delete from the Palo Alto Cortex XDR app.

operations.title: Get Policy
operations.description: Retrieves the policy for a specific endpoint from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the endpoint ID specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID
parameters.name: endpoint_id
parameters.tooltip: String the represents the endpoint ID. e.g. 51588e4ce9214c63b39d054bd073b93a
parameters.description: Specify a string that represents the endpoint ID for which you want to retrieve the policy from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, 51588e4ce9214c63b39d054bd073b93a

operations.title: Get Device Violations
operations.description: Retrieves a list of filtered device violations from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID List
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of endpoint IDs.
parameters.description: Specify the list of endpoint IDs based on which you want to retrieve violations from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Vendor
parameters.name: filter.in.vendor
parameters.tooltip: String value that defines the vendor. e.g. Check Point
parameters.description: Specify the string value that defines the vendor whose associated violations are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, Check Point

parameters.title: Vendor ID
parameters.name: filter.in.vendor_id
parameters.tooltip: Vendor ID. e.g. 0x0999
parameters.description: Specify the string value that defines the vendor ID whose associated violations are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, 0x0999

parameters.title: Product
parameters.name: filter.in.product
parameters.tooltip: String value that defines the product. e.g. VPN & Firewall-1
parameters.description: Specify the string value that defines the product whose associated violations are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, VPN & Firewall-1

parameters.title: Product ID
parameters.name: filter.in.product_id
parameters.tooltip: String value that defines the product ID. e.g. 0x10036
parameters.description: Specify the string value that defines the product ID whose associated violations are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, 0x10036

parameters.title: Serial
parameters.name: filter.in.serial
parameters.tooltip: String value that defines the serial number. e.g. 8888889
parameters.description: Specify the string value that defines the serial number whose associated violations are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, 8888889

parameters.title: Hostname
parameters.name: filter.in.hostname
parameters.tooltip: Name of host.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the host whose associated violations are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Username
parameters.name: filter.in.username
parameters.tooltip: Name of user.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the user whose associated violations are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: filter.in.type
parameters.tooltip: Type of violation. e.g. cd-rom, disk drive, floppy disk or portable device
parameters.description: Select the type of violations that are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between CD ROM, Disk Drive, Floppy Disk, or Portable Device.

parameters.title: IP List
parameters.name: filter.in.ip_list
parameters.tooltip: List of ip addresses.
parameters.description: Specify the list of IP addresses whose associated violations are to be retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Violation ID List
parameters.name: filter.in.violation_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of violation IDs.
parameters.description: Specify the list of violation IDs that you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Timestamp After
parameters.name: filter.gte.timestamp
parameters.tooltip: Timestamp of the violation.
parameters.description: Timestamp of the violation.

parameters.title: Timestamp Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.timestamp
parameters.tooltip: Timestamp of the violation.
parameters.description: Timestamp of the violation.

parameters.title: Search From
parameters.name: cursor.search_from
parameters.tooltip: Integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want violations returned.
parameters.description: Specify the integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want this operation to return incidents from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Search To
parameters.name: cursor.search_to
parameters.tooltip: Integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want incidents returned.
parameters.description: Specify the integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want this operation to return incidents from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Sort by Field
parameters.name: sort.field
parameters.tooltip: The field by which you want to sort the violations.
parameters.description: Select the field by which you want to sort the endpoints retrieved by this operation. You can from options such as serial, product, username, etc.

parameters.title: Sort by Order
parameters.name: sort.keyword
parameters.tooltip: The order by which you want to sort the violations.
parameters.description: Select this option to order the endpoints retrieved by this operation. You can choose between asc (ascending) or desc (Descending).

operations.title: Get Distribution Version
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all the agent versions that are used for creating a distribution list from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

operations.title: Create Distributions
operations.description: Creates an installation package on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the distribution name and description, and the package type specified.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: A string representing the name of the installation package.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the name of the installation package that you want to create on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Package Type

Standalone.title: Platform
Standalone.name: platform
Standalone.tooltip: The platform on which the installation need to be done.
Standalone.description: If you choose the 'Standalone' operator, then from the Platform drop-down list, select the platform on which you want to create the installation package. You can choose the following: Windows, Linux, Macos, or Android. Also if you choose 'Windows', 'Macos', or 'Linux', then in the Agent Version field, enter the version of the agent. For example, 5.0.7.16157.

Upgrade.title: Upgrade
Upgrade.name: upgrade
Upgrade.tooltip: Upgrade of an agent from ESM. The values can be given are windows_version, linux_version, macos_version
Upgrade.description: If you choose the 'Upgrade' operator, then in the Upgrade field, specify the version of an agent that you want to upgrade from ESM. You can specify the following values: windows_version, linux_version, or macos_version.

parameters.name: package_type
parameters.tooltip: A string representing the type of package to create.
parameters.description: Select the type of installation package that you want to create on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose from the following types: Standalone or Upgrade. If you choose the 'Standalone' operator, then from the Platform drop-down list, select the platform on which you want to create the installation package. You can choose the following: Windows, Linux, Macos, or Android. Also if you choose 'Windows', 'Macos', or 'Linux', then in the Agent Version field, enter the version of the agent. For example, 5.0.7.16157 . If you choose the 'Upgrade' operator, then in the Upgrade field, specify the version of an agent that you want to upgrade from ESM. You can specify the following values: windows_version, linux_version, or macos_version.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: String representing information about the package.
parameters.description: Specify the string containing descriptive information about the installation package.

operations.title: Get Distribution Status
operations.description: Checks and retrieves the status of an installation package from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the distribution ID specified.

parameters.title: Distribution ID
parameters.name: distribution_id
parameters.tooltip: A string representing the installation package ID.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the ID of the installation package whose status you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

operations.title: Get Distribution URL
operations.description: Retrieves the distribution URL for downloading the installation package from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the distribution ID and package type specified.

parameters.title: Distribution ID
parameters.name: distribution_id
parameters.tooltip: A string representing the installation package ID.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the ID of the installation package whose distribution URL you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Package Type
parameters.name: package_type
parameters.tooltip: A string representing the type of installation package.
parameters.description: Select the type of installation package whose distribution URL you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose from the following options: sh-For Linux, rpm-For Linux, deb-For Linux, pkg-For Mac, x86-For Windows, or x64-For Windows.

operations.title: Get Audit Management Logs
operations.description: Retrieves audit management logs from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Email
parameters.name: filter.in.email
parameters.tooltip: User's email address.
parameters.description: Specify the email address of the user whose audit management logs you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: filter.in.type
parameters.tooltip: Type of audit log.
parameters.description: Specify the type of audit management logs you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Sub Type
parameters.name: filter.in.sub_type
parameters.tooltip: Subtype of audit log.
parameters.description: Specify the sub-type of the audit management logs you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Result
parameters.name: filter.in.result
parameters.tooltip: Result type. e.g. SUCCESS
parameters.description: Specify the result of the audit log using which you want to filter the audit log management logs retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, SUCCESS.

parameters.title: Timestamp After
parameters.name: filter.gte.timestamp
parameters.tooltip: Log timestamp.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime of the log till when you want to retrieve audit management logs from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. This operator will retrieve all audit management logs whose timestamp matches the time specified or the time later than the time specified on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Timestamp Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.timestamp
parameters.tooltip: Log timestamp.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime of the log from when you want to retrieve audit management logs from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. This operator will retrieve all audit management logs whose timestamp matches the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Search From
parameters.name: cursor.search_from
parameters.tooltip: An integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want management logs returned.
parameters.description: Specify an integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want management logs returned.

parameters.title: Search To
parameters.name: cursor.search_to
parameters.tooltip: An integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want management logs returned.
parameters.description: Specify an integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want management logs returned.

parameters.title: Sort by Field
parameters.name: sort.field
parameters.tooltip: The field by which you want to sort the management logs.
parameters.description: Select the field by which you want to sort the audit management logs retrieved by this operation. You can choose between type, sub-type, or result.

parameters.title: Sort by Order
parameters.name: sort.keyword
parameters.tooltip: The order by which you want to sort the management logs.
parameters.description: Select this option to order the audit management logs retrieved by this operation. You can choose between asc (ascending) or desc (Descending).

operations.title: Get Audit Agent Report
operations.description: Retrieves agent event reports from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_id
parameters.tooltip: Represents the endpoint ID.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the ID of the endpoint whose associated audit agent reports you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Endpoint Name
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_name
parameters.tooltip: Represents the endpoint name.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the name of the endpoint whose associated audit agent reports you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: filter.in.type
parameters.tooltip: Type of report. e.g. Agent Status
parameters.description: Specify the type of audit agent reports you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, Agent Status.

parameters.title: Sub Type
parameters.name: filter.in.sub_type
parameters.tooltip: Subtype of report. e.g. Fully Protected
parameters.description: Specify the sub-type of the audit agent reports you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, Fully Protected.

parameters.title: Result
parameters.name: filter.in.result
parameters.tooltip: Result type. e.g. SUCCESS
parameters.description: Specify the result of the agent report using which you want to filter the audit agent reports retrieved from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, SUCCESS.

parameters.title: Domain
parameters.name: filter.in.domain
parameters.tooltip: Domain of the agent. e.g. WORKGROUP
parameters.description: Specify the domain of the agent whose audit agent reports you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. For example, WORKGROUP.

parameters.title: xdr_version
parameters.name: filter.in.xdr_version
parameters.tooltip: XDR version.
parameters.description: Specify the XDR version for which you want to retrieve audit agent reports from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Category
parameters.name: filter.in.category
parameters.tooltip: Type of event category.
parameters.description: Select the type of event category of the audit agent reports you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose from the following options: Status, Audit, or Monitoring.

parameters.title: Timestamp After
parameters.name: filter.gte.timestamp
parameters.tooltip: Report timestamp.
parameters.description: Datetime of the report till when you want to retrieve audit management logs from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. This operator will retrieve all audit agent reports whose timestamp matches the time specified or the time later than the time specified on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Timestamp Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.timestamp
parameters.tooltip: Report timestamp.
parameters.description: Datetime of the report from when you want to retrieve audit management logs from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. This operator will retrieve all audit agent reports whose timestamp matches the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Search From
parameters.name: cursor.search_from
parameters.tooltip: An integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want agent reports returned.
parameters.description: Specify an integer representing the starting offset within the query result set from which you want this operation to return incidents from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Search To
parameters.name: cursor.search_to
parameters.tooltip: An integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want agent reports returned.
parameters.description: Specify an integer representing the end offset within the result set after which you do not want this operation to return incidents from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Sort by Field
parameters.name: sort.field
parameters.tooltip: The field by which you want to sort the agent reports.
parameters.description: Select the field by which you want to sort the audit management logs retrieved by this operation. You can choose between type, category, trapsversion, timestamp, or domain.

parameters.title: Sort by Order
parameters.name: sort.keyword
parameters.tooltip: The order by which you want to sort the agent reports.
parameters.description: Select this option to order the audit management logs retrieved by this operation. You can choose between asc (ascending) or desc (Descending).

operations.title: Blacklist Files
operations.description: Blacklists the specified files that have not already been blacklisted on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the list of file hash values and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Hash List
parameters.name: hash_list
parameters.tooltip: String that represents a list of hashed files you want to blacklist. Hash must be a valid SH256.
parameters.description: Specify a string that represents a list of file hash values you want to blacklist on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Note: Hash must be a valid SHA256 value.

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.name: comment
parameters.tooltip: String that represents additional information regarding the action.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a string containing descriptive information about this action.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: The incident ID related to the hash.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ID of the incident related to the specified file hash to include the Blacklist Files action in the Cortex XDR Incident ViewTimeline tab.

operations.title: Whitelist Files
operations.description: Whitelists the specified files that have not already been whitelisted on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the list of file hash values and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Hash List
parameters.name: hash_list
parameters.tooltip: String that represents a list of hashed files you want to whitelist. Hash must be a valid SH256.
parameters.description: Specify a string that represents a list of file hash values you want to whitelist on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Note: The hash must be a valid SHA256 value.

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.name: comment
parameters.tooltip: String that represents additional information regarding the action.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a string containing descriptive information about this action.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: The incident ID related to the hash.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ID of the incident related to the specified file hash to include the Blacklist Files action in the Cortex XDR Incident ViewTimeline tab.

operations.title: Quarantine Files
operations.description: Quarantines files on specified endpoints on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the list of endpoint IDs, the file path, and the file hash specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID List
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of endpoint IDs.
parameters.description: Specify a list of endpoint IDs representing the endpoints on which you want to quarantine files on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: File Path
parameters.name: file_path
parameters.tooltip: String that represents the path of the file you want to quarantine.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the path of the file you want to quarantine on the specified endpoints on Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: File Hash
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: String that represents the file's hash. Hash must be a valid SHA256.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the hash value of the file you want to quarantine on the specified endpoints on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Note: The hash must be a valid SHA256 value.

operations.title: Get Quarantine Status
operations.description: Retrieves the quarantine status for a specific file from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the endpoint ID, file path, and file hash specified.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID
parameters.name: endpoint_id
parameters.tooltip: String the represents the endpoint ID.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the endpoint ID whose associated files' quarantine status you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: File Hash
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: String that represents the file hash. Must be a valid SHA256.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the hash value of the file whose quarantine status you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Note: The hash must be a valid SHA256 value.

parameters.title: File Path
parameters.name: file_path
parameters.tooltip: String that represents the file path.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the path of the file whose quarantine status you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

operations.title: Restore File
operations.description: Restores a quarantined file on a specified endpoint on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the endpoint ID, file hash, and other input parameters specified.

parameters.title: File Hash
parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.tooltip: String that represents the file in hash. Hash must be a valid SHA256.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the hash value of the quarantined file that you want to restore on the specified endpoint on Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Note: The hash must be a valid SHA256 value.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID
parameters.name: endpoint_id
parameters.tooltip: String that represents the endpoint ID.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the endpoint ID on which you want to restore the specified quarantined file.

parameters.title: Incident ID
parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.tooltip: String representing the incident ID.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the ID of the incident related to the specified file hash to include the Restore Files action in the Cortex XDR Incident ViewTimeline tab.

operations.title: Retrieve File
operations.description: Retrieves a file from specific endpoints from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the list of endpoint IDs, file path, and other input parameters specified. Note: You can retrieve up to 20 files from a maximum of 100 endpoints.

parameters.title: Endpoint ID List
parameters.name: filter.in.endpoint_id_list
parameters.tooltip: List of endpoint IDs.
parameters.description: Specify the list of endpoint IDs whose associated files you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Files
parameters.name: files
parameters.tooltip: A dictionary containing the type of platform.
parameters.description: Select the type of operating system from which you want to retrieve files from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between Windows, Linux, or Macos.

parameters.title: File Path
parameters.name: file_path
parameters.tooltip: The file path from which you want to retrieve the file.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the path of the file used to retrieve files from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Distribution Name
parameters.name: filter.in.dist_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the distribution list.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the name of the distribution list containing the files you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Group Name
parameters.name: filter.in.group_name
parameters.tooltip: Name of endpoint group.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the name of the endpoint group containing the files you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Alias
parameters.name: filter.in.alias
parameters.tooltip: Endpoint alias name.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the alias of the endpoints whose associated files you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Hostname
parameters.name: filter.in.hostname
parameters.tooltip: Name of host.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the name of the host of the endpoints whose associated files you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: IP List
parameters.name: filter.in.ip_list
parameters.tooltip: List of ip addresses.
parameters.description: Specify the string representing the list of IP addresses containing the endpoints whose associated files you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Platform
parameters.name: filter.in.platform
parameters.tooltip: Type of operating system. e.g. windows, linux, macos, android
parameters.description: Select the type of operating system that contains the endpoints whose associated files you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. You can choose between Windows, Linux, Macos, or Android.

parameters.title: Isolate
parameters.name: filter.in.isolate
parameters.tooltip: If an endpoint has been isolated.
parameters.description: Select the isolation status of the endpoints whose associated files you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR. Select Isolated to retrieve endpoints that are isolated and Unisolated to retrieve endpoints that are unisolated.

parameters.title: First Seen After
parameters.name: filter.gte.first_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was first seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints, whose associated files you want to be retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were first seen at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: Last Seen After
parameters.name: filter.gte.last_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was last seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints, whose associated files you want to be retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were last seen at the time specified or the time later than the time specified.

parameters.title: First Seen Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.first_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was first seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints, whose associated files you want to be retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were first seen at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

parameters.title: Last Seen Before
parameters.name: filter.lte.last_seen
parameters.tooltip: When an endpoint was last seen.
parameters.description: Select the DateTime using which you want to filter the endpoints, whose associated files you want to be retrieved by this operation to include only those endpoints that were last seen at the time specified or the time earlier than the time specified.

operations.title: Retrieve File Details
operations.description: Retrieves details for a specific file from Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the action ID specified.

parameters.title: Action ID
parameters.name: group_action_id
parameters.tooltip: Action ID retrieved from the action Retrieve File.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the action ID whose associated file details you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

operations.title: Execute XQL Query
operations.description: Execute xql query on Palo Alto Cortex XDR based on the Query and other parameters specified.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.name: query
parameters.placeholder: For Eg: dataset=xdr_data | fields event_id, event_type, event_sub_type | limit 3
parameters.tooltip: Specify the XQl query.
parameters.description: Specify the XQl query you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Tenants ID
parameters.name: tenants
parameters.tooltip: Specify the tenants.
parameters.description: Specify the tenants to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Start Datetime
parameters.name: from
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the start date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve incidents.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the start date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve incidents.

parameters.title: End Datetime
parameters.name: to
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the end date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve incidents.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the end date of the time range within which to search for and retrieve incidents.

operations.title: Get Query Results By Query ID
operations.description: Retrieve unique execution ID used to retrieve the results by the Get XQL Query Results API.

parameters.title: Query ID
parameters.name: query_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the XQl query.
parameters.description: Specify the XQl query you want to retrieve from Palo Alto Cortex XDR.

parameters.title: Pending Flag
parameters.name: pending_flag
parameters.tooltip: Default True
parameters.description: Indicates whether the API call should operate in synchronous/blocking mode, or in asynchronous/non-blocking mode

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Integer representing the maximum number of results to return. If the 'limit' is not specified or if 'limit' is greater than 1000 and the query yields more than 1000 valid results, a stream id will be generated for use in the Get XQL Query Results Stream* API. In the context of multi-tenant investigations, when you specify the parameter value (x), it will return x results across all tenants combined, rather than x results for each individual tenant. For example, if there are y tenants participating in the investigation, the maximum number of results returned can be x*y (up to the limit of 1,000,000).
